FuncDef:
The check-origin-as enable command allows the received BGP Flow Specification routes carrying a filtering rule that is based on the origin AS number of the destination IP address to be valid.
The undo check-origin-as enable command restores the default setting.
By default, the received BGP Flow Specification routes carrying a filtering rule that is based on the origin AS number of the destination IP address are invalid.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
BGP Flow Specification peers can advertise a filtering rule that is based on the origin AS number of the destination IP address. To allow the received BGP Flow Specification routes carrying a filtering rule that is based on the origin AS number of the destination IP address to be valid, run the check-origin-as enable command.
Precautions
If the check-origin-as enable command is not configured, the device considers the received BGP Flow Specification routes carrying a filtering rule that is based on the origin AS number of the destination IP address invalid.
